title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Water damage. Cleaned with UC. Checked pins 17/18 and 27/28 at ISL. Changed few resistors and ISL. Fixed Q5300 missing 2 pads and made jumpers for pins 3 and 4.

PP3V42 --- 3.47V
PPBUS ---- 12.59V
PP5V_S5 pulses
PP3V3_S5 pulses
PM_BATLOW_L pulses
SMC_ADAPTER_EN pulses

What could I be missing?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Does CPU VCore pulse?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
No.
PP3V3_S3 --- 0.1-0.3V pulses
PP5V_S3  ---- 0V

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Ok check all rails for shorts? Very common for PP5v_S3 to short near the Audio Chip.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: You're right. I get almost full short on PP5V_S3. Time to look where it pops out. Thanks John!

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: You're welcome! Let us know if that fixes the issue.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: I found U4800 heating. Removed it and PP5V_S3 bumped to 0.105V diode mode. Schematics says Critical Omit. Can I start board without it or first replace/check/etc?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: If that relieved the short, you will be fine without it. It's for the IR controller which is not used by literally anyone. Make sure the short is gone, and if so, see if it starts.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Okay, just plugged in charger. Nothing. It shows on DMM 0.004V diode mode and slowly goes to 0.105V. But no voltage when I connect charger.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: I'm guessing the short is still there then check resistance mode what is your resistance to ground on PP5v_S3?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: After unplugging charger, shows 10 Ohms then goes to more than 6 kOhms. As soon as charger connected, resistance drops to very low like 10 Ohms.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Do not measure resistance with power applied!!!!! Good way to destroy your multimeter. If it is 6kohms with no power applied, then the short should be gone. You didn't inject voltage with the charger plugged in did you???

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
I just wanted to edit post above to say clearly that resistance is not measured with power applied.

I didn't inject voltage with charger plugged in.

So, charger connected, board doesn't start. I unplug it, check resistance (10 Ohms and goes slowly to 6 kOhms). Okay, should be good, thinking to myself. Connect charger again, nothing. Unplug it, check resistance, same thing. 10 Ohms to 6 kOhms.

Edit: so whatever gets power on that rail when charger is connected is obviously pulling down whole rail since it gets hot I think. While not hot, it acts "normal"?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Hmm ok gotcha. Sounds to me like there is still some kind of short on PP5v_S3. Inject voltage and see if there is any current draw.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: I've injected 1V, nothing. Probably should go more?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Yes for sure. Inject 5 volts and see if any amperage draw. If nothing, then my guess is either U4800 is needed for boot, or there is another issue on the board somewhere.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
There is no short at all.
Allow 10-20s after power removed, before measure continuity on the board.
Any pulse at 5V_S3 now?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
I don't understand. I measured diode mode 20 seconds after power was removed and DMM shows 0.110V.

There is no voltage on 5V_S3. Barely goes from 0V to 0.02 and back. 3V3_S3 cycles though.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
0.110 is not low value at all.
Don't write the end "v" when you post diode mode value; can generate confusion with voltage measurment.
We know what diode reading means.

Remove Q7221 and check again all the voltages which pulse before.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Q7221 removed.
PP3V42, PPBUS, PP5V_S5 present.
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V
PM_BATLOW_L 0V

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Did you try original Apple 60/85W charger?
Check PM_SLP_SUS_L and 3V3_SUS.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Yes. I have tried original charger. 
No voltage on PM_SLP_SUS_L and 3V3_SUS.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
If board starts with battery + charger, check watage charger on system report.

"SMC_ADAPTER_EN 0V
PM_BATLOW_L 0V"
Usually sign of incorrect charger...
I doubt to be SMC issue, as the board works on battery.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
When Q7221 was removed, I didn't have any voltage on pin 5 P3V3S5_EN_L.

Q7221 is back now. Laptop doesn't start with battery and charger plugged in. Battery voltage without charger is 11.5V.

When I use it on DCPS with original charger head, laptop draws 20mA.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
"When Q7221 was removed, I didn't have any voltage on pin 5 P3V3S5_EN_L."
Why would you want to have voltage on an active low enable signal?

"PM_BATLOW_L pulses
SMC_ADAPTER_EN pulses"
Do you have steady 0V now???

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
"Why would you want to have voltage on an active low enable signal?"
It was present on pin 2 Q7221 P5VS3_EN_L, but only because it's connected to PP3V42, right?

Yes, I have 0V now.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
P5VS3_EN_L should be low (0V) to enable 5V_S3 power rail.
That's  the reason I told you to remove Q7221.
In this way, both 3V and 5V sections of U7200 are always enabled.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Well, that wasn't the case here. No 5V coming from U7200 with Q7221 removed.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
"Remove Q7221 and check again all the voltages
-----------------
No 5V coming from U7200 with Q7221 removed."
You didn't mention that untill now...

So post now U7200 voltage, pins 16, 13, 3, 8, 17, 1.
Check R/C7260, R7267/68 and Q7260/61.

Q7221 removed, of course...

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Q7221 now removed & pad voltages:
pin 1 - GND
pin 2 - 3.45V
pin 3 - 0.74V
pin 4 - GND
pin 5 - 0V
pin 6 - 0.9V

U7200 voltages:
pin 16 - 12.59V
pin 13 - 3.42V
pin 3 - 2V
pin 8 - 3.3V
pin 17 - 5V
pin 1 - 0.9V

R7260 pin 1 (0.568) pin 2 (0.568)
C7260 pin 1 (0.568) pin 2 (0.118)
R7267 pin 1 (0.118) pin 2 (0.677)
R7268 pin 1 (0.677) pin 2 (GND)
Q7260 pins 123 (0.118) pin 4 (0.647) pin 5 (0.423)
Q7261 pins 123 (GND) pin 4 (0.613) pin 5 (0.118)

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
"Check R/C7260, R7267/68 and Q7260/61."
I was refering to their integrity and correct value...

If all resistors and traces are OK around U7200, change the chip.
Post resistance to ground at L7260; diode mode, both ways (red and black to ground).
Maybe Q7260/61 need to be changed too.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
U7200 area looks good. 
Red on ground: 0.121
Black on ground: 1.070

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
You could have a problem outside of that power supply.
But must check and change all possible there first.

Cannot get any pulse at L7260?
Check when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L...

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: No pulse on L7260

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Recheck all traces and resistors.
L7260 should have 5V with provided values (when Q7221 removed).
Change U7200 and Q7260/61 too.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Replaced U7200 and Q7221. PP5V_S3 is present now. I seem to have S3 rails now, but not S0.

PP5V_S0 - 0.033 resistance

Am I safe if I inject more than 1V into the line since it feeds some 1V lines?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
0.033 in diode mode is aprox 60 ohms.
Usually you cannot heat anything with 5V there.
But you can try, maybe some IC enter in avalanche process and overheats...

First remove U5850 and test again.
I found bad keyboard backlight circuit few times.

PM_SLP_S3_L goes high, or pulses at least?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Okay, so I've removed and replaced U7100 and U7600 and PP5V_S0 is back to normal 0.360.

I'm drawing 44mA from DCPS. PP5V_S0 not present though.

I have lower resistance in Ohms on CPU compared to known good (10 vs 17 Ohms).

PM_SLP_S3_L - 2.26V
PM_SLP_S3_L - 0.038

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
"10 vs 17 Ohms"
Could be the difference between processor type; i.e. i5 vs i3 (or i7 vs i5).

"PM_SLP_S3_L - 2.26V
 PM_SLP_S3_L - 0.038"

If PM_SLP_S3_L goes high, PP5V_S0 should come on too.
If not, change Q7860.

2.26V is a bit on the bottom edge of high level; should be closer to 3V (usually 3.3V).
Check PM_SLP_S3_L on both pins of R7978.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Something pulls down PM_SLP_S3_R_L, or bad R7978...
Remove Q7802/12, Q7931 and Q5300.
One of them bad, has leakage, or corrosion.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Okay, removed Q5300, PM_SLP_S3_L seems normal now. (0.462).

Can I start without Q5300? I doubt since it's PBUS Voltage Sensor?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
You can try at least.
Better to solve the problem there first; change Q5300.

Do you get 3.3V at PM_SLP_S3_L now?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Yes, PM_SLP_S3_L has 3.3V. Laptop starts, fan spin. Q5300 needs to be taken care of. 

How did you find out that something related to PM_SLP_S3_R_L could be bad?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: In base of your measurements...

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Ah okay, so based on R7978 pin 2 which is PM_SLP_S3_R_L. That's why some other signals such as CPUVCCIOS0_EN were lower than on known good, but I've put it aside for now.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Laptop starts now, draws around 700mA, fan spins, but also beeps one time every few seconds. No image or chime.

I tried different RAMs.

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Try new BIOS file...

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: I did. No luck

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message: Any other ideas? Maybe another BIOS chip from same board?

title: 820-2936-B Rails pulse (except PP3V42 and PPBUS)
message:
Monitor CPU VCORE.
Do you see any drop from 1.1-1.2V to 0.75-0.85V after few seconds?

Where did you get the BIOS dump?
BIOS chip from other board will have dirty ME region, but should serve for test...
